google_play_reviews.content: My first true roguelike game. I actually like it.
Mind bending exploration of the possibilities of living in a negatively curved plane
Good game of hyperbolic geometry. The gold version is more updated though.
Accidentally deleted my character with the creative mode, had to Uninstaller and reinstall. Add a button to go back to your default character please.
I think you and Tehora can think about extending this to 3d (or more d's (-;) and make this game more interactive using VR. It would give u an opportunity to earn reasonable amount of money ðŸ¤‘
I don't understand what to do, but it's very fun

Good casual game, is very different game with different perspective. The description is wrong, is not a roguelike game ("INSPIRED by" however miss some much features form the genre that should remove the word) and is a different kind of puzzle. Overall cool game.

This game is actually really fun, and it brings a twist to the old roguelike formula. I really like the boundless exploration element in the game, and the huge array of different creative areas and difficult puzzles. I think the dev managed to exploit the unique features of hyperbolic geometry really well, and it comes with decent explanations on the nature of this space. Serious musst-play for math lovers (and maybe haters?) anywhere.
Great rogue like game concept.
Pretty good only real compliant here is that it has a tendency to crash, seems to happen right when I would have game over'd.

Defintely one of the best games I've ever played. Even with it's simplistic visualisation, the whole world is so immersive and the hyperbolic projection just adds to that so much more. The soundtrack is also very interesting but very fitting for every area. The only issue I have is the lagging in the game. I have a pretty descent mid-range phone and in the first few seconds the game runs very smoothly, but if I start moving around, it dropps down to like 20-30 fps consistently.
Awesome

I want so badly to like this game, but the usability issues make it almost unplayable. The menus are awful, and the UI constantly misplaces a tap, which is an incredibly frustrating reason to lose a round. Shame, because the idea is genius and I really wanted to buy the paid version. Edit: it also crashes a lot. That's more understandable given how complex the game is, but a save/load system would help make that less painful.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review! There is a "casual mode" in special modes, which enables you to save/load on collecting an Orb of Safety.

google_play_reviews.content: Didn't know there was a mobile port of this game. Easily got me hooked.
Brilliant
Amazing! I love roguelikes and this is a great way to kill time. Clever concept, tons of zones and monsters, what's not to love? I will definitely get gold addition. Good job developer.
Very fun and creative roguelike. And yes, this is a real game. The non-euclidian geometry is used in many creative ways. I love it â™¡
Amazing and fun! It's even better on PC.
Awesome app, i dont even know how you coded this but kudos!
One of my favourite indie games of all time. 10/10 Buy it on STEAM to support the developer.

One of the few great games you can find on mobile. No ads, no IAP, nothing like that. I think I remember that the Ivory Tower once aligned the camera so that "Up" will always be on the upper side of the screen. Was that a thing? Is there an option to do that?
Great game, wish it was easier to play in first person.
You've done pretty well making this a strategy game considering that I understand absolutely nothing for my first few playthroughs. Good job!
Phenomenal

Brilliant game, and non-Euclidean geometry is truly weird and awesome. I wish people who make roguelikes didn't insist on making them so impossible to be "faithful to the original experience" though, because there's a reason I didn't play the old originals. It got much easier when I realized you could switch windows IF you use an orb of safety first though. (Seriously though, who thought up that mechanic? I mean, what if someone NEEDS to reply to a work email in the middle of a game?)

I love the concept. But exploring the concept is impossible if the most basic of state saving does not happen. No modern game should reset to the beginning if you receive a phone call or your screen turns off for a second. Even dreck games showing ads every five seconds have this figured out; please raise your standards to at least this level and I'll give you the five stars I desperately want to give.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks for the review! The issue you mention (crash on phone call / screen turning off) should hopefully be fixed in 12.0v.

(HyperRogue has a feature to keep the progress in case when you switch to another app, but sometimes newer versions of Android introduce changes which causes this feature to crash the game instead :/)

google_play_reviews.content: Classic rogue-like, including brutal difficulty, with a twist of hyperbolic space!
would be 5 stars if it paused when i exit the app. love thegame otherwise
Great gamplay and conscept but the tablet seems to have this bug where if i close or exit the app It stops working and thinks im still playing Like whats wrong man?
Thank you for bringing this game to mobile ðŸ¥º
This is an incredible game that takes the illusion to a whole new world.
Doesn't save, ever. If you get a phone call or otherwise switch out of the app, chances are, your progress is completely gone.

Thanks for the review! The issue you mention (crash on phone call / screen turning off) should hopefully be fixed in 12.0v.

(HyperRogue has a feature to keep the progress in case when you switch to another app, but sometimes newer versions of Android introduce changes which causes this feature to crash the game instead :/)

google_play_reviews.content: The gameplay itself is great, but trying to navigate through the menus is frustrating to impossible. The world overview menu, which lists all the lands, and gives hints on how to unlock them, randomly zooms in and out, and makes it all but impossible to actually use. It also makes playing other modes extremely difficulty to access. The pure tactics mode is my favourite in the desktop version, but it takes 5-10 tries fighting the menus to even get to it once. I want to use this on mobile, but...
I like heptagons
Really needs to be fixed for certain devices, I love the concept but it won't even open on my device.
It has a lot of potential, but it needs to automatically pause when you leave the app. Having it reset the game every time you get a phone call or accidentally hit the back button is too frustrating.

Thanks for the review! The issue you mention (crash on phone call / screen turning off) should hopefully be fixed in 12.0v.

(HyperRogue has a feature to keep the progress in case when you switch to another app, but sometimes newer versions of Android introduce changes which causes this feature to crash the game instead :/)

google_play_reviews.content: I have absolutely fallen in love with this game on desktop. It's a really unique experience and an excellent time killer when you begin to get into it. Only thing I can complain about is the fact that the mobile port seems to have quite poor performance. Also some smaller things, again about the port, the top bar is quite annoying when trying to play in landscape mode, and the controls for e.g. the shoot 'em up mode feel incomplete.

Playing this game is thrilling. It has different worlds with cool transitions between worlds.. Gaining points, killing enemies, power up baits are very exciting.. It is simple and smart. I think playing this game improves your skills. The more you explore, better is your experience with this game.

This roguelike is simple to play at first, but requires more and more strategy as you progress and offers more variety. You don't need to know anything about hyperbolic geometry to play; you'll be able to learn the important parts in the tutorial or simply while playing. If you play a lot, you should check the wiki for advanced tips, and join the discord server! This game is very customizable, but a lot of the settings do require some knowledge in geometry, and some work better on a computer.
Terrible
Great, but black screen after I minimize, even closing app doesn't fix it. So I either have to uninstall and reinstall, or restart the phone to go back to the game.
Frequent crashes. Typically every other app-start is a crash. Otherwise... Great Fun.
Very good if you want to work on your spatial reasoning skills. would recommend if you can understand how the geometry works

Really addictive mathematical game! Absolutely love it. Sometimes caught out by the negative Gauss curvature making straight lines diverge. Unfortunately keeps crashing when I exit the app and as a result I lose my progress whenever I check my messages etc. Would love a "save state mode" where you are able to save game.
Unique.
Though the basic gameplay's a little barebones, the novel concept more than makes up for it.
Pretty cool concept.

One of the only games I give five stars! The gameplay is challenging, addictive, and entertaining! The graphics are simple, yet very well polished, and can be customized to your liking! This game can give players so much freedom! I only have one question: what does the mirror orb do? It says it can only be used by mirror cloud things, but when I tap it, it doesn't activate. What am I missing?
Crashes a lot
A most addictive education in unintuitive geometry.
I love geometry and roguelikes. This was a very cool idea.
Absolutely genius use of mathematics in making an addictive game. Bravo!
I absolutely love this game.
5 star game on a computer. 4 star on mobile phones. I have a largeish phone, but the game seems too cramped for mobile phones. I prefer to play this game via Steam.

It's good. The only problem I have seen is that it doesn't run smoothly (but I don't think it's utterly developer's fault) and that various game modes (like shot 'em all) controls needs improvement/tweaks.
Great concept and execution, just a few repetitive crashes here and there keep me from 5 stars.
Great game, but I strongly prefer playing it on pc...

Honestly one of the greatest roguelikes of all time. The underlying concept is incredibly strong and creative, the gameplay is simple but difficult to master and it comes with a bunch of different modes. There's just too many problems for me to reccomend fully, and too many unintuitive choices that make it needlessly difficult to get into. Once you're into it though, WOW.

A while back I played this game and was already impressed by the hyperbolic 
geometry. Now this game has al these amazing ways to play it. My favourite 
is the hyperbolic rug in tutorial mode. There is only one thing I can think 
of that could be improved and that is the controls. I often press stuff by 
accident, which is kind of annoying.

It's very tricky, but quite rewarding. Many game modes lead to interesting 
and varied play.

A roguelike dungeon crawler unlike any other I know of. Mechanically simple 
with easy replayability and lots to explore. There's no inventory 
management or character building, so when a run ends it doesn't feel too 
punishing- you just want to start over to try and beat your score. The 
various worlds are wildly creative and varied, with each having a distinct 
feel. You'll find you have favorites and ones you prefer to avoid, but none 
really feel like the game would be better without them. The fact that you 
could end up in any of dozens of different worlds, just as a function of 
constantly forging ahead to seek treasure and avoid death, is the core 
appeal.

As a mathematical toy or mathematical artwork, this is good. As a game, 
it's mainly repetitive and punishing. The difficulty comes via combat, and 
combat is boring and (unless you have rare skill at chess) basically 
random. So you'll make mistakes occasionally, and most mistakes will force 
you to restart. The game tempts you with powerups, but these are temporary 
and come only at random times (as far as I know), so they don't help much. 
And pursuing them brings many extra enemies. It is very unpleasant to be 
punished for trying to become stronger... I appreciate the work and 
imagination that went into this game, but I find the actual game to be 
nearly impossible to play.
Addictive game.  Much more fun than net hack.
The reason I used 4 stars is because I can accidentally press the vector graphics thing which I don't like.

This game is amazing. I have spent hours on end just trying to beat it, while being captivated by how hard the Dev worked to make this game into an experience and cram as much fun content into the hyperbolic plane.
Its alright? Creative graphics but no real gameplay

Wonderfully rich game. So much content and it is very unique yet true to a roguelike game. I am continuously pleasantly surprised by the clever mechanics of each land. It's easy to get into, but requires skill as you progress further and further. Average game lengths can be from 10 to 20 minutes depending on your own pacing and skill. Probably longer if you are very good.

Mind bogglingly cool roguelike. The spatial distortion has some really profound and subtle impacts on strategy, especially when running away or jockeying for battle position. Playing this for just a few days has been enough to give me non-euclidian nightmares.
Amazing game. I would like it If there was a mode where you are immortal and can just explore the game.
Just a perfect game
Amazing concept brilliantly implemented. There is no better game of this genre on Android.
A really clever and unique game, which I would buy & play continually if I didn't have to start over from 0 every time. Keep working on this, dev!
Too bad it goes through my battery like a junkie
Unique and entertaining rogue-like puzzle game
